line.en: '...Everything that happened yesterday, well,\nthat's just how things are for me at home.'
'I'm sorry I caused everyone trouble.'
After explaining the situation to everybody,\nKotori gave a deep bow.

As I had already told everyone about the balloon
incident and her staying quiet about the glider
to her parents and Hibari no one was shocked to
hear her tell it.
'That's all well and good but...'
'...You're not going to quit, right?'
'That's right. At least, not until summer ends.'
'What do you mean?'

'I made a promise with Hibari. I said I'd tell
everything myself once summer vacation was over,
and I asked her not to say anything to our dad
until then.'
Hibari had seemed a bit disappointed at the idea,\nbut ultimately had agreed to Kotori's request.
No matter what, Kotori is her little sister.
'I thought if my parents knew about the glider,\nthey'd be against it.'
'But it's not just that... I knew that they would\ndefinitely make me go back home.'
'Ridiculous...'
'Well, if they said no, I was planning on\nquitting after the break ends.'
'Quit? Hold on... That's just...'
'I'm sorry, Ageha...'
Ageha bit her tongue as Kotori apologized.
She knew that persisting would only cause trouble\nfor Kotori.
'Wouldn't it be all right if you were just a\nmember of the club? You don't have to fly.'
Kotori shook her head.
'I don't think he'd allow me to do anything\nrelated to it. And... I don't think anyone would\nbelieve me anyway.'
We won't know how her father would react until it\nactually happens.
But she did keep it a secret.
It would be naive to think you could be trusted\nagain after that.
'Thanks to you all, I now know what it feels like\nto fly.'
'Since I won't be able to fly again, I don't\nthink I can stay anywhere near a glider.'
'We all reap what we sow. There's nothing else\nthat can be done. It's all my fault.'
Asa started to look sad.
Meanwhile, Yoru didn't seem convinced.
'Well then... I'm quitting too.'
'What!?'
'Hey, hey. What did you just say?'
'Well! I'm only here because it's fun. If it's\nnot fun, it's not worth doing.'
'If Kotori isn't going to be here, I quit too.'
Looking disappointed, Ageha folded her arms\nbehind her head.
'Quitting...'
'Don't be ridiculous. After all you did to make\nit this far?'
'We all worked together to fix the glider so\nAmane could fly...'
'After the garage was destroyed, Asa helped us\nfind this great place.'
'And after we finally finished the repairs and it\ncan fly again... Now you can finally do what we\nwere planning to.'
'Well, yeah.'
'But it doesn't matter if it's gliders or\nwhatever. If I thought the robot club would be\nmore fun, I'd be in it instead.'
'Making stuff with you, Aoi, and Amane is fun.\nThat's why I picked this club.'
'Kotori, doing stuff with you is what's fun.'
'If you're not here, it'll be a complete bore.'
'Uwa... Ageha...'
Kotori gave Ageha a look filled with both\nhappiness and frustration.
'...I agree.'
'Aoi, you too?'
'I didn't only want to fly the glider. Yeah, it\nwas really fun. I liked it a lot, but...'
'It was only fun because you all were here.'
If all I wanted to do was fly, I could have just\ngone to the gliding field and flown until I was\nsick of it.
It was amazingly fun and I didn't want to quit.
It wasn't what I truly wanted, though.
'If we can't do it together...'
'Ah, but what about Asa!'
Asa looked as if she was about to cry.
'...I'm fine. I mean, I'm sad that it's all over,\nbut this friendship is so beautiful.'
'And yeah, I'm the same...'
'I didn't join the Soaring Club because I wanted\nto fly.'
'I joined the club so I could be friends with you\nall.'
'Hmm... Don't be overdramatic.'
'I am not! It's the truth!'
'Well, I guess it's true. If all I wanted was to\nfly, I'd just have to ask my grandfather and I'd\nbe in the air in no time.'
'What we're saying is, if you quit then the\nSoaring Club is disbanding.'
'What? No! You can't do that! It'll be all my\nfault!'
'It's fine to feel that. It's the truth.'
'She is the club leader.'
'Uwa... You guys.'
'Look, this is all beside the point. Let's just\nfocus on the Morning Glory until summer is over.'
'After that, who knows.'
'Basically, nothing has to change.'
'C'mon, let's go, Kotori!'
You could almost say this problem made us all\ncloser. At least, it seemed like everyone felt\nthat way.
'Hey Aoi, so, should we talk about that thing?'
'Oh yeah.'
'Well, about the flight... That is, when Morning\nGlory makes its appearance.'
'Kotori, you're going to be the main pilot.'
Frustrated by having her hands held back by Asa,\nKotori listened to me dumbfounded.
'You've got enough skill to be the pilot. You\ndon't have enough experience, but I'll help with\nthat.'
'But, Aoi, you want to fly...'
'Well, yeah. That's true. But it's fine with me\nas long as someone flies over the clouds.'
'Ageha, are you guys all right with this...?'
'Hey, I don't even really want to fly.'
'If someone else wants to fly, I'm more than\nwilling to let them.'
'If it's fine with everyone else, it's fine with\nme.'
'I'm not even part of the club.'
'You guys...'
'All of this for me... Thank you!'
Kotori looks as if she is about to cry tears of\njoy.
'Well, that's not quite right. We're not doing\nthis for you.'
'I'm doing this for myself.'
'Same here.'
'Yeah, yeah, me too.'
'Me too.'
Not knowing how to take it all, Kotori began to\nshow a complex mix of emotions.
I almost laughed at the odd combination of tears\nand look of bemusement on her face.
'So, don't even think about not doing it.'
'You can fly if you want to.'
'...Okay!'
Kotori started to cry again, this time with a\nsmile on her face.
'I'm back!'
'Hmm?'
Someone scribbled a note and left it on the\ndining hall table.
'I'm going home for a bit. - Kanako'
'Kana's not here today.'
'Seems so.'
'Same with Asa and Yoru. It's just the two of\nus.'
'...Seems so.'
Since it was Asa and Yoru's turn to watch over\nthe secret base, they were going to be spending\nthe night there.
They said they would be eating over there and had\nbought some snacks at a convenience store. Felt\nlike they were having a trip.
Even though we realized it was going to just be\nthe two of us, we pretended to ignore the fact.
'I'm going to go wash my hair to since I'm all\nsweaty.'
Kotori left the dining hall.
'...I guess I'll get changed too.'
For some reason I started to worry about smelling\nsweaty. I decided to head back to my room and get\nchanged.
'Don't come in until I say it's okay.'
'...Are you really all right?'
'I said I'm fine. Make sure Aoi doesn't come in,\nHat.'
'If he tries to, give him all you've got.'
'Quaaack'
Hat menacingly flapped his wings my way.
Shrugging my shoulders, I left the room.
It seems like Kotori is making dinner tonight.
Since she doesn't want me to see how she cooks,\nshe kicked me out of the kitchen.
'Sigh. I wonder if she really is okay.'
Maybe she'll cut herself with a knife, or burn\nherself on the stove.
Starting to become anxious, I tried to peek\nthrough a gap in the door, but Hat was keeping\nwatch like a loyal guard dog.
I could bust my way through, but that would only\nmake Kotori upset.
I'd like to avoid that kind of conversation\ntonight.
'Hmm... I am worried, though.'
If I could see her from here, I probably wouldn't\nbe all that concerned.
Not being able to see anything only made me worry\nmore.
Trying to listen in on what was happening, I\nsuddenly realized something.
If Kotori's father knew about the glider, he'd\nprobably feel like this.
Even if he didn't know anything about gliders,\nhe'd definitely understand what the Soaring Club\ndoes.
It's obvious. They would clearly be flying.
So of course he'd be extremely worrisome about\nsomething terrible happening to his daughter.
It's probably only because Hibari came here so\noften and knew us all that she'd promise to wait\nuntil 'the end of summer'.
The phone in the hall was ringing.
Since I had a cell phone it was almost never\nused. Yet it was ringing now.
Slipping past the gaze of Hat the watch-duck, I\nheaded towards the entrance.
'Who could it be? Kanako, maybe?'
'Flying Fish Manor.'
'Excuse me, but is the manager, Minase-san,\navailable?'
The caller was a man.
'Speaking. May I ask who's calling?'
'This is Kotori Habane's father.'
My mind instantly went blank.
'Ah, uh... hello. Er, right now she's...'
'Actually, it's not Kotori who I called to speak\nwith.'
He quickly corrected me.
'Ah... Well then, how can I help you?'
'I want to speak with you, Minase-san.'
Me?
What could he want to talk to me about?
Did Hibari tell him about the glider? Was he mad\nat me for not saying anything to him?
Which means... Is he planning to bring Kotori\nback home? Is he calling to talk about the\narrangements?
I braced myself and listened to what Kotori's\nfather had to say.
'...I'm calling to thank you.'
'Huh? Thank me?'
'That's right. Hibari has told me a lot.'
Hearing him say Hibari's name made my heart stop.
I quickly regained my composure.
If there was a problem he wouldn't be calling to\nthank me.
'The other day when she... when Kotori came home.\nI heard you helped make that happen.'
'She usually is reluctant to come home, but you\nhelped persuade her.'
'I didn't really do much...'
'We hadn't been together as a family like that\nfor quite some time. Thank you.'
'You called just to thank me...?'
'I'm embarrassed to say it, but yes. I'm sure\nthat's confusing for you, but I just had to thank\nyou.'
'No, don't worry about it at all. I'm glad to\nhelp, even if a little.'
I paid him a little lip service, since I didn't\nknow what else to say.
He sounded to be about the same age as my own\nfather.
'She... Kotori was happy too.'
'She really seemed really happy when she was\ntalking about her time at home.'
'She did?'
He seemed surprised and gracious at the same\ntime.
Such a simple thing really seemed to make him\nhappy.
'(I can't... I can't tell him that the pandas\nwere the thing she was most excited about...)'
'I see... So she really was happy...'
'Yeah, she was.'
I wasn't lying.
She did really seem to be happy when talking\nabout being with her parents.
'I heard about what it's like there from Hibari\nand Kotori's homeroom teacher...'
So even Kotori's homeroom teacher had spoken with\nhim.
I hadn't thought about the possibility, even\nthough it makes a lot of sense in hindsight.
'I heard she hasn't been paying attention in\nclass, and that she has been doing poorly in some\nsubjects.'
'She said Kotori doesn't have many close friends\nand has been increasingly absent from school...'
His voice was somber.
Hearing that would make him worry.
It was heart wrenching just imagining how he must\nfeel.
'This have been steadily changing since last\nsummer. She's made friends and her grades have\ngotten better.'

'Yeah. When I started working here, she didn't
seem to get along with the other borders. But now
she's talkative, and she's good friends with
everyone.'
I tried to be as cheerful as possible.
I wanted to make it seem as if he didn't need to\nworry as much anymore.
'Hibari told me that it was all because of you.'
'I even heard she was adapting to school and\nmaking more of an effort.'
'Well, it wasn't just me...'
It was really all thanks to her meeting Amane and\nAgeha. Heck, even the glider had a big impact. I\ndidn't really do anything.
But I didn't tell him that.
'Should I go get Kotori? Since you called, you\nmay as well talk with...'
'No, that's quite alright.'
He was surprisingly blunt.
'She probably hasn't forgiven us just yet.'
The slight cheerfulness that came to his voice\nhad already faded.
'She hides it, but I know how she feels. We're\nthe reason she left home.'
'Even though she has absolutely no interest in\nengineering...'
Kotori had lied about her interest in engineering\nand came to Keifuu Academy.
Her parents believed her, but came to realize it\nwas a lie once they heard about her grades.
At the same time, that lie revealed another\nhidden desire.
My mom and dad always looked sad. It was like my\nlife had ended.
That continued for so long... I couldn't take it\nanymore, so I decided to leave the house.
That bitter emotion had made it all the way to\nher parents.
That was the reason Kotori's father had not come\nto see her all the way up until her recent trip\nback home.
'I'm the reason she lied, though.'
A deflated voice came out of the receiver.
It was obvious that he had been living with this\nregret over the past few years.
'...Our home just hasn't been the same ever since\nshe left.'
'Perhaps our family can become whole again.'
'When Kotori came back, even my wife was happy.\nIt was just like the old days.'
'I talked with my wife after Kotori went back. If\nonly that accident hadn't happened... Every day\nwould be like that.'
'Yeah...'
'Well...'
'...Maybe we can live like that again someday.'
'This is all thanks to you.'
I sensed a tinge of sadness in his gratitude.
Through that, I could tell he was sincere.
'I think Kotori changed because she wanted to.'
'All I and everyone else did was simply be here\nwith her.'
It wasn't because of her legs.
You help friends. That's all there is to it.
Changing a bit from the influence of your friends\nis natural. It would happen to anyone.
I wasn't sure if my message got across, but her\nfather repeated 'Thank you.' once again.
'Please take care of my daughter.'
Saying that, he hung up.
I hung up the phone with a sigh.
If he had known about the glider, there is no way\nhe would have spoken to me like this.
However, I didn't think it would be wise to tell\nhim.
Not knowing what to do left me with a heavy\nfeeling.
'Were you on the phone?'
'Hm? Oh, yeah.'
Kotori seemed to have come out of nowhere.
'Who was it?'
'The gardener. I just figured that they need to\ncome soon to do some work.'
'Aha... Hat has been poking around all over the\nplace. It's a bit of a mess.'
I lied without even thinking about it.
'Is dinner ready? I'm getting a little hungry.'
'Yep, it's finished!'
Dinner was laid across the dining hall table.
'Croquettes?! I love croquettes!!'
'...I hope you'll like them.'
A large pile of barrel-shaped croquettes are\nsitting atop a large plate.
All of them were fried to a golden brown, though\na few had crushed spots.
I quickly took my seat.
'Can I eat?'
'Yeah, go ahead.'
'Alright!'
I started to dig into the piping hot croquettes.
'Mmm, these are great!! But something's a bit\ndifferent about this one.'
'That's a croquette made with meat and potatoes.\nThis is a regular croquette.'
'A meat and potato croquette? I've never had one\nof these before.'
Kotori seemed to enjoy watching me munch away at\nher cooking.
'When did you learn to cook like this?'
'These croquettes are my mom's specialty.'
'Ah, so what that means is...!'
Kotori nodded.
She had made a promise to me a bit back.
Since her mother taught her to cook, she was\ngoing to make something for me.
'Sorry it took so long to happen. There was never\nreally a good opportunity.'
Croquettes do take quite a long time to make.
Since we were busy every day at the club, she\nnever had the time.
'Hmm, so this is what your mom's cooking tastes\nlike.'
'She hasn't even taught my sister yet. It's quite\nthe secret!'
The coating was crispy and the inside was\ndelectably soft.
A few of them were a bit misshapen, but they were\nundoubtedly delicious.
'Crunch, crunch, chew, chew. These are so good\nwith rice! More please!'
Like a child, I lifted up my rice bowl and Kotori\nhappily wheeled off to get me more.
'Eat as many as you want. It's okay if you eat\nthem all.'
They were so good that I wanted to do just that,\nbut there were just too many.
The large plate had two regular plates worth of\ncroquettes piled up in a pyramid.
I ate as many of Kotori's croquettes as my\nstomach would allow.
'Whew... I... am... full...'
I threw my overstuffed body onto my bed.
'That was so good. I'm stuffed.'
'Hehehe, I'm glad you liked it.'
Having her cooking praised really seemed to make\nKotori happy.
'Hold on a minute, okay? I'll be fine in a bit.'
I laid on the bed until my stomach settled a\nlittle.
While I was resting, Kotori began staring at the\nbicycle decorating the corner of my room.
'You sure do take good care of it.'
'...Yeah, it's sort of a habit. I can't sleep if\nI don't do it. Even though I don't ride anymore.'
'You don't?'
'I couldn't even if I wanted to.'
Kotori looked at my right knee.
'It looks completely fine, but I guess it really\nisn't.'
'I could probably ride around a little bit. But\nthere's no way I could race.'
It's no fun if I'm not riding at full speed.
Plus, I'd probably want to go faster, push too\nhard, and then hurt my knee again.
'Hmm... I really wanted to see you ride your\nbicycle.'
'I bet you look so amazing.'
'I can show you.'
I pulled myself up and fumbled through my desk\ndrawer.
After a bit of searching I pulled out an album.
'My friends in the Cycle Racing Club made this\nfor me when I transferred schools.'
It was filled with pictures of the club and match\nrecords.
'...Wow. You had so many great friends.'
'Well, when I got it, it kind of felt like a\nstrange way of them saying they hated me.'
I laughed and Kotori gave me a funny look.
'Because, you know, when I left it was kinda like\nI was running away from bicycles. And then they\ngive me this.'
'When I got it, I just shoved it to the bottom of\nmy drawer. I forgot I even had it.'
'But you can look at it now...?'
'I guess.'
All thanks to the glider and making new friends,\nI suppose.
'Now I appreciate their thoughtfulness. I really\ndon't have any bad memories from back then.'
'Wow! You look so young there.'
'...I looked a bit like a punk.'
It was a picture of me from the first grade. I\nreally looked like a child.
'Hahaha, that's so cute! I love it, Aoi. I just\nwant to pinch your cheeks!'
'Guys don't like it when you say they're cute,\nyou know.'
Kotori laughed at my sullen tone in a way that\nimplied even that was cute.
'...You look so handsome in your bicycling\nuniform.'
'Hey, this bike can go really fast, right? About\nhow fast can it go?'
'Hmm.. Well, if I pedal as fast as I can, I could\nprobably go a bit faster than a car at normal\nspeed.'
'Faster than a car!?'

'There's no way I could keep that speed up the
whole time, of course. But at the sprint right
before the goal, when I use my legs full blast,
yeah, it can go pretty fast.'
'Full blast?'
'Basically using up all the energy you stored\nup.'
'Ah... Wow! That's a really steep hill.'
'We call it a 'hill climb'. It's really, really\ntough.'
'It looks like it. Just look at your face here.'
'Let me tell you, though. After you struggle and\nstruggle up the hill, there's quite a prize\nawaiting you.'
'Going downhill.'
'Downhill...?'
'Yeah, going downhill gets you going really fast.\nIt feels amazing.'
'Hmm... It must feel like riding to the top of a\nvertical draft and gliding far off.'
'Well... It's similar, but still different. The\nsense of speed is much higher on a bicycle.'
Moving across the ground really makes the\nsensation real.
It feels great to be hundreds of meters above the\nground in a glider - but it's not the same.
'Bicycles...'
'You were in the Volleyball Club, right?'
'Yeah. At first I was a spiker, but since there\nwas no setter, I switched.'
'I was pretty good so I could play anywhere.'
'Cool. Do you have an album or anything?'
Kotori flashed an awkward smile.
'I threw them all away.'
'Ah. Sorry I brought it up.'
'No. Actually, seeing your album makes me sort of\nregret doing that. They weren't bad memories. I\nwish I had kept them.'
'I would have loved to see pictures of you from\nback then. I bet you were really cute.'
'Maybe.'
She nodded quickly.
'Not really modest, huh...'
'Well, we had a reputation in our neighborhood\nfor being the 'beautiful sisters'.'
'But it wasn't really much of a contest. Hibari\nwas way more popular than I was.'
'She would even get love letters from nearby\ntowns once in a while.'
'Ah, I can see that happening.'
Kotori looked offended after hearing me murmur\nthat.
'But you must have been popular too, right?'
My heart was pounding as I asked.
'Well... maybe.'
Kotori had an annoyed look on her face as she\nanswered.
'But I had absolutely no interest in boys back\nthen. I never dated anyone or anything.'
'The first guy I ever liked was... well... you.'
Even though she was smiling, she still seemed to\nbe a bit embarrassed to say it.
I was extremely happy, but...
'By the way, about the way we talk to each\nother.'
'Well, if we are going to be together...\nShouldn't you try to be more relaxed when you're\nwith me?'
'Uh... Yeah... I guess.'
'Say that you like me again.'
'Huh? All of a sudden?'
'Why not? It's no good if you're not relaxed. Go\nahead. Try.'
'Uh... Okay... I like yo... u... Ao... Aoi.'
'Hey.'
'It's hard. I'm just so used to being nervous...\nTrying to be more relaxed is... I'm just...'
'...Don't worry about it.'
'Ah... I'm sorry. I'll try.'
'You have to, okay?'
'Okay. I promise.'
Kotori began flipping randomly through the album.
Aside from the pictures, my race results were\nalso in there.
Although she probably didn't understand them, she\nstared at them with great intensity.
'Hey.'
'Hm?'
'...When you had your accident, you fell from a\nballoon, right?'
'Yeah.'
Kotori raised her head.
'And flying a glider isn't scary?'
'Not at all.'
She spoke confidently.
When Hibari talked about it, she turned really\npale. It seemed like it had been a terrible\naccident.
However, Kotori didn't seem to be scared at all.\nNot even when doing spin recovery training.

'Ever since I was a kid, I wanted to be up in the
sky. So... One time when we were traveling, I
heard about a hot air balloon ride. I begged and
begged, and so they let me ride it.'
'Then the accident happened.'
'But it was the first time I had flown in the sky\nlike that. It was really fun.'
'I'll never forget how the sky looked from that\nhot air balloon.'
'So that... that's kind of a good memory.'
'Yeah.'
I could tell her response was completely honest.
'My accident happened while I was going\ndownhill.'
'The cyclist in front of me fell, and I went down\nas well.'
'But I still remember how good it feels to be\ngoing downhill. I can even remember going up to\nthe winner's podium.'
'That's what Ageha regretted not being able to\nsee. I would have liked to have seen it too.'
'Back then I only really wanted to ride. I didn't\nreally care about the results.'
'Going up to the winner's podium, being\ncongratulated by my coach and teammates...\nAn-chan was really happy.'
'I really got a taste for it then. I got too\nenthusiastic when I was going downhill, and then\nI got into the accident.'
'Nothing good ever happens to people who don't\nhave desires.'
Kotori looked as if she half understood.
'If.. If you could ride again, would you?'
'Hmm... Yeah, if I could, I would love to.'
'Right now I have the glider. Don't you think\nit's a bit more than just a hobby?'
She seemed a little relieved to hear me say that.
'The doctor told me while I was in rehab that if\nI had surgery, I could probably compete again.'
'...Really?'
'But it's a huge operation. It would cost a lot\nof time and money, and it's not guaranteed I'd\nheal up right.'
'I couldn't make up my mind, so I didn't do it.'
I was told I had a fifty-fifty chance of\nrecovery.
Now I understand why I couldn't make up my mind\nback then.
I was scared.
If it wasn't a success, I'd never have another\nchance to be healed again.
I wanted to think I still had that chance to be\nhealed.
Maybe that's ridiculous. Without that chance,\nthough, I'd probably go crazy.
'Could you have the surgery now?'
'...I 'm not sure. I'd have to ask a doctor.'
'It'd be good if you could do it...'
'Why?'
'Well... Look. Once summer is over... the Soaring\nClub will...'
'Oh yeah, it's going to disband.'
'...I still can't really believe it.'
'Hmm. Well, in that case yeah I guess I could\nhave the surgery. Of course, our school doesn't\nhave a Cycle Racing Club.'
Rather than do that, making a club that wouldn't\nworry Kotori's parents seemed like a more\ninteresting option.
'Well, you should, then. And then you can let me\nride on the back of your bicycle again.'
Kotori was talking as if it had already been\ndecided.
Of course if all I was going to do was that, I\ndidn't need the surgery.
'Can I borrow this album?'
'Sure, but what are you going to do?'
'Look at it until I burn every photo into my\nmemory.'
There was something scary about that.
However, as she stared at each page of the album,\nI could tell she was not exaggerating.
I went to the kitchen to clean up.
Kotori was at the table, intensely looking\nthrough the album
'...Aren't you bored?'
'Nope.'
She didn't even lift her head to answer.
She looked like an archeologist trying to\ndecipher an ancient text.
'...This rugged looking guy...was he your best\nfriend?'
'For a while now he's been appearing everywhere.\nSeems like he's almost glued to you...'
'Ah, is that Takenaka?'
'Takenaka... Rugged Takenaka...'
She repeated herself as if to memorize it.
'Everyone looks so close.'
'I guess. I still keep in touch with them now.'
'I even got a message asking to meet up this\nsummer since it's been so long. I told them I was\ntoo busy, though.'
'...So you're still good friends with Takenaka.'
'Oh yeah. Is it alright if I take a picture\nlater?'
'Sure but... why?'
'To send to him. He won't shut up about showing\nhim a picture of you.'
At first he was proud of me, but then he became\nintensely jealous, and he started begging to see\na picture.
'...That's a good idea. You can show off to him\nwith a picture of you and your respectable\ngirlfriend.'
She murmured while looking at a picture of me and\nTakenaka with our arms over each other's\nshoulders.
I wondered what she could be imagining.
'Alright, the dishes are done. It's so much\neasier when it's just the two of us.'
My job would be so easy if it were always like\nthis.
'Well then. I think I'm going to wash up. How\nabout you? Are you going to take a bath?'
'Eh? O-okay...'
Kotori fell silent all of a sudden as her face\nblushed.
'...I-I'm thinking about going in the\nbathtub...umm.'
She glanced at me, stealing a look at my face.
'Eh? okay...umm.'
'B-but...if I go in myself, I might drown again\nso...'
*glance* *glance*
'...Then how about I come in with you?'
